Home/ Building a bridge with design kit

Overview

Communicating Material Design Production Team’s value at Google through storytelling and Figma prototyping.

Summary

Following major Design Kit updates in 2022, team lead Euphrates Dahout identified a need to clarify our team's role within Google’s UX community. We created an engaging story-driven prototype to demonstrate why teams should adopt our Design Kit with confidence.

Context

After ADS 2022 (Android Developer Summit), we wanted to share our recent work and findings with the broader team in a memorable way.

Problem

How do you communicate the importance of maintaining a Design Kit at Google scale? We structured our message around Why (why it matters), How (how it works), and What (what it is), using interactive Figma prototyping to create a “choose your own adventure” experience for Google's design community.

My Role

I proposed the solution and crafted the core message. Using storytelling expertise, I developed an analogy that explains what makes our Design Kit essential. I created the visual language and storyboard, which, together with Ronnie Montoya, we crafted into a prototype and distributed company-wide, then shared on Google’s Figma Community page.

Result

The prototype successfully positioned the Production Team as the bridge between Material Design and internal designers. We received positive feedback from multiple teams, saw increased Design Kit adoption, and reinforced confidence in adopting our tools through our demonstrated expertise.
